home.subtitle: The tech-innovation hackathon at Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile

explainer.title: A Hackathon for Innovation for Every Student
explainer.overview_text: A 9-hour hackathon where students build innovative tech solutions together. No matter your major or experience level, join us to create, learn, and connect with fellow innovators.
explainer.inclusivity_text: Participate solo or form a team of up to 3 people. No prior experience needed! Your challenge: develop a solution to a real problem facing the university community. Whether you're a beginner or a pro, everyone has something to contribute.
explainer.venue_text: Join us on Friday, December 5th, 2025 at the Centro de Extensión, Campus Oriente, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile

sponsors_explainer.subtitle: The student tech-innovation community of Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile

questions.title: Have Questions?
questions.p1: Check out our Frequently Asked Questions section or reach out to us directly at hack [at] osuc.dev

introduction_section.title: About us
introduction_section.p1: Open Source UC (OSUC) is the leading student tech-innovation community at Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.
introduction_section.p2: Since 2006, we have led technology innovation projects created by students, for students, fostering collaboration and hands-on learning.
introduction_section.p3: Now, we expand our impact with Hackscate: a space where ideas transform into real solutions.

event_section.title: The Event
event_section.p1: Hackscate is a 9-hour hackathon where students from all majors and levels collaborate to build innovative tech products that solve real problems.
event_section.p2: We'll bring together 60 innovators at Centro de Extensión, Campus Oriente UC-Chile, creating a unique environment of creativity, learning, and networking.
event_section.p3: The event will take place on Friday, December 5th, 2025.

profile_section.title: Our Attendee Profile
profile_section.card1_title: Eager to learn and try new products
profile_section.card1_desc: Our attendees are early adopters who actively seek out cutting-edge tools and technologies. As we have seen with previous sponsors like GitHub, ~70% of students jumped to try GitHub Copilot.
profile_section.card2_desc: They're collaborative hands-on developers who transform ideas into working prototypes in 9 hours.
profile_section.card3_desc: Most attendees are in their final years of study, with strong academic backgrounds and hands-on project experience. ~40% are actively seeking internships or full-time roles.

contact_section.title: Contact Us
contact_section.p1_start: If you have any questions or inquiries, feel free to reach out to us

footer.made_by: Made with ❤️ by Open Source UC

legal.disclaimer_full: This event is organized by Open Source UC and is not managed by Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.

questions.question: What is Hackscate?
questions.answer: Hackscate is a 9-hour hackathon organized by Open Source UC, bringing together students from all majors to build innovative tech products in a collaborative environment.

questions.question: When and where is the event?
questions.answer: Hackscate will take place on Friday, December 5th at Centro de Extensión, Campus Oriente, Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.

questions.question: Who can participate?
questions.answer: The event is open to all university students, regardless of their major or level of experience. It is not exclusive to students from Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.

questions.question: Do I need prior programming experience?
questions.answer: No! Hackscate is designed to be accessible to everyone. Whether you're a beginner or experienced developer, you'll find your place here.

questions.question: How do I register?
questions.answer: You can register through our official website or on the event page at MLH.

questions.question: Is there a participation fee?
questions.answer: No, participation in Hackscate is completely free for all attendees.

questions.question: Can I participate alone or do I need a team?
questions.answer: You can participate alone or form a team of up to 3 people. Both options are welcome!

questions.question: What should I bring to the event?
questions.answer: We recommend bringing your laptop, charger, student ID, and any other materials you consider necessary for your project.

questions.question: Will there be food and drinks during the event?
questions.answer: Yes, we will provide food and drinks for all attendees throughout the event.

questions.question: Will there be options for special diets?
questions.answer: Yes, we will offer options for special diets. Please let us know your needs when you register.

questions.question: How are the winners selected?
questions.answer: Projects will be evaluated by a panel of judges based on criteria such as innovation, impact, execution, and presentation.

questions.question: Can I attend if I'm not a student at Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile?
questions.answer: Yes, the event is open to all university students, regardless of their educational institution.

questions.question: Will there be prizes for the winners?
questions.answer: Yes, there will be prizes for the winning teams, which will be announced during the event.

questions.question: Can I use any technology for my project?
questions.answer: Yes, you are free to use any technology, programming language, or platform you prefer to develop your project.

questions.question: Will there be mentors available during the event?
questions.answer: Yes, we will have mentors available to help and guide you throughout the event.

questions.question: What should my project focus on?
questions.answer: We recommend focusing on solving real problems facing a university community, but you are free to explore any innovative idea you have in mind.

schedule.layout_description: Discover the exciting schedule of events planned for Hackscate
